intro: Argostemma nutans, commonly known as the nodding argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that droop downward. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Argostemma nutans is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
